clinical_study.brief_title: Topo-guided LASIK and Photorefractive Keratectomy vs Wavefront LASIK and Photorefractive Keratectomy
clinical_study.official_title: Outcomes of Topography-guided LASIK and Photorefractive Keratectomy Compared to Wavefront Optimized LASIK and Photorefractive Keratectomy

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the difference in results between eyes that have been treated wavefront optimized laser vision correction compared to eyes treated with topography-guided laser vision correction. Each participant will receive wavefront optimized correction in one eye and topography-guided correction in the other.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Each participant will receive wavefront optimized surgery in one eye and topography-guided surgery in the second eye.
study_design_info.masking_description: Participants will be masked as to which type of surgery they receive in either eye.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in uncorrected visual acuity at 1 day post surgery
primary_outcome.description: uncorrected visual acuity will be measured at baseline and day 1 (+/- 1 day)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in uncorrected visual acuity at 1 week post surgery
primary_outcome.description: uncorrected visual acuity will be measured at week 1 (+/- 3 days)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in uncorrected visual acuity at 1 month post surgery
primary_outcome.description: uncorrected visual acuity will be measured at month 1 (+/- 10 days)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in uncorrected visual acuity at 3 months post surgery
primary_outcome.description: uncorrected visual acuity will be measured at month 1 (+/- 2 weeks)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in uncorrected visual acuity at 6 months post surgery
primary_outcome.description: uncorrected visual acuity will be measured at month 6 (+/- 1 month)

primary_outcome.measure: Change in uncorrected visual acuity at 12 months post surgery
primary_outcome.description: uncorrected visual acuity will be measured at month 12 (+/- 1 month)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in contrast sensitivity at 3 months post surgery
secondary_outcome.description: Contrast sensitivity will be tested pre-operatively and 3 months post-operatively (+/- 14 days)

other_outcome.measure: Change in degree of higher order aberrations at 3 months
other_outcome.description: Aberrometry measurements will be taken pre-operatively and 3 months post surgery (+/- 14 days)

other_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life score at 3 months
other_outcome.description: The validated QIRC survery will be administered pre-operatively and 3 months post surgery (+/- 14 days)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- All subjects who are deemed suitable candidates for laser refractive surgery after routine refractive surgery screening will be considered eligible for participation in this study.
Subjects must be at least 21 years of age and not pregnant or nursing (due to fluctuations in visual parameters during pregnancy)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any patient who is not a suitable candidate for LASIK or PRK will not be included.
